page.title: 11RIVERS & STREAMS_EPPERSTONE
page.content:
The{Dover Beck}which is managed by the Severn Trent Water Authority flows throughout the year though water meadows with willows on the banks and through natural woodland.The{Order {Beck}joins the Dover Beck along with an unnamed stream from the N.W.at Wash Bridge,these don't flow in the summer. { Dumble}is the name given to the deeply cut streams to the North.The streams in the Thurgarton and Halloughton Dumbles usually flow thoughout the year and are very deep in relation to the size of the stream.They support ribbons of wildlife and vegetation. The Village{Water Supply}is not drawn from these but is pumped from the Bunter Sandstone Beds.
{
